unit_learning_outcomes.description: understand, explain and compare the current remediation technologies from a management point of view
demonstrate verbal and written communication skills by disseminating knowledge to a specialist audience
describe laboratory and field methods for sample collection and analysis of pollutants
research the emerging developments in environmental remediation and critically assess their commercial readiness
work independently and in a team to assess complex environmental problems and propose technological solutions for remediation
interpret and evaluate data for enviromental risk evaluation and design of remediation programs for effective management

academic_org.value: Department of Earth and Environmental Sciences

data.description: This interdisciplinary unit aims to develop an understanding of some of the impacts of human activities on the environment and the actions that can be undertaken to remediate, rehabilitate or restore degraded environments. It includes interactive classes, field-based learning and engagement to enable students to build their knowledge of the causes and impacts of environmental degradation. Students will then put knowledge into practice by developing a comprehensive remediation/rehabilitation report for a contaminated site.
